header.rec_loc: ANONâ€™s bedroom in university halls, Lancaster University, then moves to kitchen, then back to bedroom
header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Illness, tiredness, previous nights events (trip to hospital due to hurting arm), boys, university life
header.activity: Flatmates talking about life at university

body.u: what have you done today? just slept?

it's like it's like I've like had a a shot of something and it's making me like feel drowsy
like when you sometimes take I dunno antihistamines I get really sleepy but I haven't taken anything I just feel really sleepy

good yeah just take them regularly so there's no space for it to hurt again really

how are you doing kind of thing?

hit the roof yeah cos saying that I've missed like seven seminars in a row is just not that great is it to say out loud to your parents?

it I know it's not home but
no I dunno I think so I just oh I just wanna get out for a bit you know?
everyone else gets to it's just

mm or then at the same time that would make me feel even worse cos I'll just be like what am I doing here? this was not a good idea I should have just stayed cos I'm just gonna have to listen to them talk about shit I don't give a shit about
for a whole three days and act interested and together you know?
yeah yeah definitely do you think when you go home over Christmas like your mum is gonna question you about stuff? or do you think she'll leave it?
no hundred percent all interrogation always is it's not
yeah same with my family to be honest
even if I was having a good time she would still interrogate me

yeah it's gonna be like why didn't you ring us more? why have you been like crying on the phone and just not telling us what's going on? and why have you been missing everything and why have you gotten yourself into this mess? and blah blah blah blah di blah
does she know the extent of it now?
well I I dunno like it's difficult to just say oh yeah I haven't been going to this and this and
completely too depressed to get out of bed sometimes or I'm too scared to go or I just don't really give a shit or a combination erm yeah that's kind of difficult to just talk about to with my mum
she's not really that kind of person
she's not like millennial and she doesn't understand
well I mean she can be but just not about this sort of thing cos she's she's just she used to tell me to snap out of it
and she's just that's that sort of person
does she not see it as
like an emotional issue? she just sees it as like a

well I think she does more now and er I think she is trying cos she knows that like I don't like the way she has an attitude about it because of what happened like over summer and stuff and because of what happened over summer she kind of realised oh yeah is actually kind of you know struggling mentally with this and this isn't just something you she can like snap out of
realised that when I was like really hysterical over the summer and shit
but she still you know you can still sense the scepticism in her voice like
no it is shit when family just don't understand cos that's the thing cos she's not here so she can't see either

so she can't mm I mean alternatively like as I've said like when you go home for Christmas potentially it'll give you that escape that you need if you just choose to stay after Christmas like if it might in a way it might be harder to come back but then in a way it might be easier because then you wouldn't be completely trapped like you have gone home sort of thing rather than
if I carry on and go and do the plan of like going home at Christmas on the I'd still have to come back
either way like if I was gonna leave I'd have to come
back and get my stuff and it's ridiculous

like I dunno I don't know why cos I remember when I went home when I dropped out I was like telling my parents I'm gonna get a job I'm gonna do this and I didn't and I don't know why I didn't I just like probably I wouldn't be in have got in such a mess if I had done that but I just thought it would be easier not to

like a break turned into I sai I I'll have a few weeks' break from everything and sort myself out but then I ended up doing nothing mm I don't know how I managed to do that it's just it's crazy thinking that now cos I used to just sit at home all day watching daytime TV
that's the thing like it's so
difficult to deal with but it's so easy to get into that
like people sometimes ask me like how did you spend the whole year just doing nothing? like
when you say you did nothing

it's literally true I didn't do a thing like all I did was sit on my phone or I just had like the radio on and I just had a cup of tea and I'd just sit on my bed and those were the only two things I would do like
and it was just nothing else like yeah I mean obviously sometimes I would go out and see my friends but very rarely but yeah but it's it's easy to waste that much time like it's so easy
and I'd like always had like a really strong kind of anxiety about getting a job even from when I was like
fifteen and sixteen or and that just what a nightmare
I mean some people are really desperate to get a job when they leave school like a lot of my friends
and they used to be really happy about it and I think like I haven I have technically I have worked so but it was for a sort of friend of a family so it wasn't
so yeah and I think I swear I've done something else but I can't remember what it is I did I do something? oh I've sent applications off but I've never actually been accepted
yeah that's the thing you realise that it's absolutely brutal it's like this horrible
paradox of if you have no experience they're not interested because you need
and it's just like there's no way to break into that without one or the other like it it really infuriates me the way that they just reject you like that
even things that are meant to be the starter job things like waitresses
yeah and the way they are in the interviews these days like they ask a lot they really do
I went I remember I went to an interview wi er an interview of Boots and it was like completely gruelling like the way they just

they just like questioned me constantly and they put me on the spot and they asked me to go out into the shop and ask people what that I I had to go like sell them something and it was just like fucking hell like this is not
I just want I just need a fucking job I was desperate by this point and I I ran out in tears cos I was just so overwhelmed by it cos like how horrible they were like

just insistent and like you have to say this and oh it was just horrible I don't y I don't know it just seemed so much easier for our parents to get work when they were younger like my mum had a job in a shop from when she was like fourteen years old
and I couldn't even get one when I was nineteen like just doing a basic job that where all we have to do is like stack shelves and that's it really

it's funny how they say that like you know for Boots and all that er when they do the and they do it in Lush as well when they kind of say the selling tactic is to press on er to like a c like a customer like press them and be like go up to them and say have you seen this? like when I don't know about other people but when people do that to me I automatically don't want the product
why why does it why do they still consider that like a?

like all I was doing like he told me to go out into the shop and pretend I was like working so I went out and like stacked some shelves and shit people came up to me like asking me questions like where's this where's that? and I had like this old lady and feel like I I did it well enough like I just said to her what are you looking for? like and I and I showed her where it was and then it was fine and I just smiled at her I didn't like insist that she bought anything and I felt like that's what that's what you'd want in in customer service rather than when
he told me told me to go off and
actually try and sell something to this like poor woman with a kid on her arm like who just didn't

yeah and it was just ridiculous and I had to do it cos he was like no you have to do it y I have to see what you know and it's just oh yeah I mean it was just disastrous really and that was like the only interview I ever got because mm

I just feel incapable of it like and

like it was so unorganised and
I just I felt like I had to do it really quickly but I didn't I couldn't do it as
quickly as the plates were coming and it was just like so scary
and it's just really stupid things like that like a tiny little job like that is just so overwhelming to me and
and that's why I didn't get a job
for the whole year like it was just ridiculous
like the thought of work is scary

yeah it's really scary and that's why I don't wanna leave because I I'm just scared like this is the next thing for me like if I leave here then I have to get a job and that's gonna be my life like it's not like I get a way out of that
it's weird to think that's a yeah
you know? it's not like I'd go back to uni cos I won't I I've I won't have a chance to when I leave here and so I just have to work all my life and it's just it's really it's
it's really petrifying cos it's just not what you want is it?
it's a sad way to live

and like work your way up kind of thing
yeah but I wouldn't even do that cos I wouldn't feel like I have the ambition or the desire to you know?

that's how I see it it's just a means to an end I only want this degree so that I can show people that I have an English degree which means that I have the skills you know transferable in the workplace for higher up jobs than waitressing you know?

and it's just you know it's just really scary like I can't get my head round that if I drop out that's what's gonna happen I can't just sit at home for a year cos the year turns into you know more than
